text.content:
CC
Follow up all chronic problems.
 
 
Subjective
The pt reports no significant interval changes.
 
Diabetes mellitus type 2
No hypoglycemia episodes.  Working on diet and exercise, but doesnt feel that it 
does any good.  Walks about 20 minutes each weekday (during her lunch break at 
work).  Says she doesnt eat much sweets but doesnt pay much attention to the 
details of her diet since diets have never worked for her in the past. 
 
Hypertension
No light-headedness.  BP has been good.
 
Postoperative hypothyroidism
No constipation, diarrhea, fatigue, insomnia or palpitations.
 
Depression
Doing well with no significant depression episodes.  No SI and no HI.
 
 
Allergies
Metformin (severe nausea)
Fluoxetine (severe anxiety)
Citalopram (severe anxiety)
 
 
PMH
Hypertension
Depression
Diabetes mellitus type 2
Hyperlipidemia
Osteopenia
History of malignant neoplasm of thyroid
Postoperative hypothyroidism
 
PSurgHx
Thyroidectomy (complete, bilateral): 2002
 
 
FamHx
Diabetes mellitus type 2 and osteoporosis in the patients mother.
 
 
SocHx
Divorced mother of 5 (her two youngest children live with her; they are 14 and 
16-years-old).
The patient quit smoking about 6 years ago.  She drink alcohol rarely.  She 
denies use of illicit drugs.
The patient works as an administrative assistant at a law firm in town.
 
 
MEDICATIONS:
Active Inpatient and Outpatient Medications (including Supplies):
 
     Outpatient Medications                                 Status
=========================================================================
1)   ASPIRIN 81MG EC TAB TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY     ACTIVE
       DAY
2)   CALCIUM CARBONATE 1.25GM (CA 500MG) TAB TAKE 500 MG    ACTIVE
       BY MOUTH THREE TIMES A DAY
3)   CHLORTHALIDONE 25MG TAB TAKE 12.5 MG  BY MOUTH DAILY   ACTIVE
4)   ERGOCALCIFEROL 1000 UNIT CAP TAKE 1000 UNITS BY MOUTH  ACTIVE
       DAILY
5)   GLYBURIDE 2.5MG TAB TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY     ACTIVE
       DAY
6)   LEVOTHYROXINE NA (SYNTHROID) 0.125MG TAB TAKE ONE      ACTIVE
       TABLET BY MOUTH DAILY
7)   LISINOPRIL 20MG TAB TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH DAILY     ACTIVE
8)   SIMVASTATIN 80MG TAB TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY    ACTIVE
       EVENING
9)   VENLAFAXINE HCL 37.5MG TAB TAKE TWO TABLETS BY MOUTH   ACTIVE
       TWICE A DAY
 
14 Total Medications
 
ALLERGIES/ADRS:
METFORMIN, CITALOPRAM, FLUOXETINE
 
OBJECTIVE:
VITAL SIGNS:
            B/P:  142/76 (11/20/2011 11:09)
          Pulse:  83 (11/20/2011 11:09)
    Temperature:  99.0 F [37.2 C] (11/20/2011 11:09)
   Respirations:  12 (11/20/2011 11:09)
         Weight:  258 lb [117.0 kg] (11/20/2011 11:09)
         Height:  64 in [162.6 cm] (07/20/2010 14:00)
            BMI:  44.38
           Pain:  0 (11/20/2011 11:09)
 
EXAM:
GEN: NAD, obese
FEET: normal monofilament test bilaterally; no abnormal lesions noted; normal DP 
pulses bilaterally
PSYCH: normal mood and behavior
 
Assessment and Plan
 
Diabetes mellitus type 2
Assessment
Control of Diabetes mellitus type 2 is stable.
Last HbA1c from about 10 months ago was 7.1 (within goal range).  MA/creat ratio 
also normal at that time.  Feet exam normal today.  Due for eye exam next year.
Plan
Check Microalbumin/Creat.
Check HbA1c
Continue Aspirin 81 mg daily to prevent  stroke
Continue Glyburide 2.5 mg daily to decrease HbA1c
Encouraged patient to limit portion sizes and avoid fatty foods and simple 
sugars.  Congratulated patient on exercise she is doing and recommended she 
increase duration of walking to 30 minutes 5 days per week.
 
Hypertension
Assessment
Control of Hypertension is stable.
Well controlled on Lisinopril 20 mg and Chlorthalidone 12.5 mg.  No light-
headedness.  Creatinine and potassium were within normal limits when last 
checked about 10 months ago.
Plan
Continue Chlorthalidone 12.5 mg daily to decrease SBP and DBP
Continue Lisinopril 20 mg daily to decrease DBP and SBP
Check Chem14
 
Postoperative hypothyroidism
Assessment
Control of Postoperative hypothyroidism is stable.
Has been well controlled; due for TSH today.
Plan
Continue Levothyroxine 125 mcg daily to decrease TSH
Check TSH
 
Depression
Assessment
Control of Depression is stable.
Well controlled on venlafaxine 75 mg BID.  PHQ-9 is very good (score = 1) and 
well within her goal range of 0 to 4.
 
Plan
Continue Venlafaxine 75 mg BID to decrease PHQ-9
 
Hyperlipidemia
Assessment
Control of Hyperlipidemia is stable.
Plan
Check Lipid panel
Continue Simvastatin 80 mg daily to decrease LDL, and increase HDL
 
Misc.
Plan
Obesity: pt agrees to set a goal to lose 50 pounds over the next year.  I 
encouraged her to focus on decreased portion sizes and to avoid high calorie 
foods including regular soda and high fat snacks.  I also encouraged her to walk 
at least 30 to 60 minutes 5 days per week.
 
RTC 6 months
text.author: AVIVAUSER,THIRTY
